content.description:
Hard for the grade, not because of the movement, but because it is difficult to read and sequenced in some of those places! I would advise stick clipping the first 2 bolts, there is a crux right off the ground, and while the first bolt protects it, a fall is not particularly kind to your belayer here.

Head straight up the first couple of bolts before traversing hard left. Head straight up a couple more bolts and then traverse under the large roof hard right. Pull the roof at the weakness, then the line should be easy to follow for the remainder as bolts are visible. 

After you pull the first roof, the next bolt is heady, but safe. There are a couple more bolts like that up higher, with the crux coming at the next bulge.

From the Amphitheater cave, start walking down the hill along the cliff, this line is about halfway down the hill. It is left of "Dyno for Tom" which has "<3 Tom" on the wall at its base and a rock with "12A" written in ash.  
11 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with a locking steel biner

climbs.name: Dyno For Tom
climbs.fa: Adam Tutte, Chris Phillips, Craig Lingley '15 FA Chris Phillips '16

content.description:
Look for the heavily chalked just rail ~2.5 m off the ground to start. The first moves off the deck give you a taste of what to expect on the route- lots of big shouldery and techy moves on good holds that are rather far apart! 

This extended section of mini-boulders separated by good rests brings you to a bulge a little bit over half height (bolt 7), with the worst rest of the route available below. Pound out the crux boulder which lacks the cherished buckets of the rest of the climb. Once you have regained buckets, clip and saddle up for a slightly runout slab section (trend slightly right for the direct, definitely slab line, or go hard left and traverse back in to the right on sandy, sometimes wet slopers).

The clip above the slab is a bit difficult/heady to hang the draw on. Do not throw for a hold in hopes of it being a bucket, you will not find one and may take a fall involving bouncing off the slab. 

Turn 2 more easy roofs to reach the anchors.

Start walking down the hill from along the Main Amphitheater wall. Mid/upper hill, look for the heavily chalked starting jug rail, with <3 Tom faintly on the wall in the alcove at the base. 
12 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with a locking steel biner

38 m line. Do NOT climb this on any rope less than 80 m, or be prepared for shenanigans!

Climb fun face to the mid-way point which is marked by a limestone-like band of features and a transition from bolts to perma-draws. Take the left branch for Falcor, general consensus is the right branch goes at hard 5.12c.

Reach up, clip your first perma, and do one of two things:
1. Be baffled at the impossibility of the slopey, downward facing holds.
2. Climb through the easy crux if you read it correctly.

Clip the 2nd perma mid-crux before clearing the boulder problem and gaining easier territory. The rest of the climb is yours to botch, and there's a lot left!

The locking biner on the chains is stuck shut, bring enough to thread your rope. 

Beta note:
If you're tall, you may be S.O.L. on this one.
Knee pad goes on your left leg if you want it/can afford it. 

2nd line right of the cave at the Amphitheater, left branch (arches back right after the branch).
10 bolts, a pile of permas, 2 bolt anchor with chains and effectively a rap ring.

Feels like an absolute Odyssey of a climb. Starts out with around 5.11aish climbing on the just off-vertical wall on good holds before turning to a mega endurance fest going right on steep terrain with perma-draws. Hard roof boulder problem guards the chains. Feels totally outrageous; bring the loaded guns!

A 70m BARELY gets you to the ground and if you don't lower to where your belayer is you will be out in space and will have to do some shenanigans to get down. There is a fixed line (Aug 2021) you can use to guide yourself to your belayer.

TIE STOPPERS 



The imposing line with chalk. 

bolts to start turns to permadraws when it gets steep, one bolt higher up, 19 bolts total. Locking biner to lower

Start off on a heavily chalked hold, with the goal of getting up and left to another heavily chalked hold left of the first perma-draw. I strongly suggest stick clipping the first perma.

Climb mid 5.11 mini-boulders up to the roof. Take a quick rest, and then clip the roof perma and floor it through the crux boulder before the pump catches up! A kind stranger has left a pair of tick marks on the crucial holds just over the lip, sadly you will not be sinking 3 pads deep into buckets on these.

Easy climbing to the chains after you turn the roof. 

The first perma-draw line left of the cave. Look for the distinctive chalked starting rail down and right of the first perma, and the next chalked rail, even with and left of the first perma. 
Permas, 2 bolt anchor with a steel locking biner
The tallest section of the wall, split by a cave right in the middle.
